ygData.subject: RE: [cantera] Input File error
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Anup, This error is probably caused by the Cantera routine get_XML_name() not being able to find the xml phase element with the correct id. In your cti

Hi Anup,

This error is probably caused by the Cantera routine
get_XML_name() not being able to find the xml phase element 
with the correct id. In your cti file, you supplied a name
for the ideal_gas phase
i.e.:

ideal_gas(name = "gri30",
          elements = .....

This names gets translated into an id for an xml phase
element, i.e., in your xml file there is a line like:

 <phase, dim = "3", id = "gri30">
  ....
  <\phase>

And, when you create the IdealGasMix object in c++ or python, the
second argument in your constructor should be the name of the phase 
(the first argument is the file name):

IdealGasMix g("gri30.cti", "gri30");

Looking at the .h file, the second argument is formally an optional
argument.
However, in reality, it's required by the underlying code to be 
correctly specified.

So, this is an inconsistency in Cantera's API, which needs to be 
addressed, and it's also an example of an uninformative original 
error message. I'll work to get both remedied. 

But, the immediate fix is to supply the correct second argument when
you create the IdealGasMix object.

Best wishes,
Harry Moffat




-----Original Message-----
From: johnny374z [mailto:akm162@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 17, 2004 8:48 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Input File error


Thanks to everyone who helped me out with my previous problems and 
bugs.  However, as always, new bugs have popped up.  This one seems 
to concern my input files.  I have created a custom input file, and 
successfully converted it to .cti format and .xml format.  There 
appear to be no errors at all in these files.  However when I try to 
create an IdealGasMix in C++, I get this error: 
************************************************
                Cantera Error!                  
************************************************


Procedure: IdealGasMix
Error:     buildSolutionFromXML returned false


This only happens when using my own .cti files, and does not occur 
when using the ones provided with the source.  If anyone has had this 
problem before and knows how to fix it, I would appreciate all the 
help I can get. 

Thanks, 

Anup Misra
